title: Scenario: Tap the MiLB class logo in the top center
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the MiLB class logo in the top center of the app
custom_expected:
Then a pop over should appear and show 6 classes:
Triple-A
Double-A
Class A Advanced
Class A
Class A Short Season
Rookie

title: Scenario: Tap the Double-A cell while in Triple-A mode
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in Triple-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB logo displaying the class name on top center
And the user taps the Double-A cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the app should switch from Triple-A to Double-A mode
And the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left on the Scoreboard
And the schedule on the page should reflect the Double-A schedule for the given day.

title: Scenario: Tap the Triple-A cell while in Double-A mode
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top left corner 
And the user taps the Triple-A cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the app should switch from Double-A to Triple-A mode
And the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left on the Scoreboard
And the schedule on the page should reflect the Triple-A schedule for the given day.

title: Scenario: Tap the Triple-A cell while in Triple-A mode
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in Triple-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB logo displaying the class name on top center
And the user taps the Triple-A cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the app should remain in Triple-A mode
And the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left on the Scoreboard
And the schedule on the page should reflect the Triple-A schedule for the given day.

title: Senario: Tap the Double-A cell while in Double-A mode.
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top center
And the user taps the Double-A cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the app should remain in Double-A mode
And the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left on the Scoreboard
And the schedule on the page should reflect the Double-A schedule for the given day.
*Repeat for all classes*

title: Scenario: Tap outside the class selection pop over.
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in a class(i.e. Triple A)
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top center
And the user taps outside the class selection pop over.
custom_expected:
Then the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left on the Scoreboard
And the schedule on the page should reflect the schedule for the day for the mode on which they were when they opened the pop over.

title: Verify: The selected mode is clearly defined and easy to tell.
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A or Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top center
custom_expected: Then the class mode which is currently active in the app should be clearly marked and visible. It should be immediately obvious to a first time user which mode is selected and which is deselected.

title: Verify: When the user selects a given class, it is clear to them which class they have selected.
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A or Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top center
And the user taps on one of the classes cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the user's selection should be clearly indicated to the user so they are immediately aware that they cell they chose has been selected.
And the scoreboard should reflect the games for the mode the user has chosen.

title: Scenario: Tap the MiLB class logo in the top center
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is in the More section
custom_steps: When the user taps the MiLB class logo in the top center of the app
custom_expected:
Then a pop over should appear with all classes:
Triple-A
Double-A
Class A Advanced
Class A
Class A Short Season
Rookie

title: Scenario: Tap the Double-A cell while in Triple-A mode
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in Triple-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top left corner 
And the user taps the Double-A cell in the pop over
custom_expected:
Then the app should switch from Triple-A to Double-A mode
And the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left in the More section
And there should be an indication that the user is now in Double-A mode

title: Scenario: Tap outside the class selection pop over.
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A or Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top center
And the user taps outside the class selection pop over.
custom_expected:
Then the pop over should dismiss
And the user should be left in the More section on the main page
And the app should remain in the Class mode that the user was on when they brought up the pop over.

title: Verify: The selected mode is clearly defined and easy to tell.
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A or Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top center
custom_expected: Then the mode which is currently active in the app (Triple-A or Double-A) should be clearly marked and visible. It should be immediately obvious to a first time user which mode is selected and which is deselected.

title: Verify: When the user selects a given class, it is clear to them which class they have selected.
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has opened the app
And the app is in either Triple-A or Double-A mode
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the More section
And the user taps the MiLB logo in the top left corner 
And the user taps the either the Triple-A or Double-A cell in the pop over
custom_expected: Then the user's selection should be clearly indicated to the user so they are immediately aware that they cell they chose has been selected.

title: Verify: When app is in Triple-A mode, all sections are consistent in showing Triple-A data
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Triple-A mode
custom_steps: When the user navigates to any section or page in the app
custom_expected:
Then the only data they should see should reference Triple-A and teams in Triple-A, all logos that appear should belong to Triple-A teams. 
(Check: 
Scoreboard, News/Video (Filter), Standings, Teams. )

title: Verify: When app is in Double-A mode, all sections are consistent in showing Double-A data
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Double-A mode
custom_steps: When the user navigates to any section or page in the app
custom_expected:
Then the only data they should see should reference Double-A and teams in Double-A, all logos that appear should belong to Double-A teams. 
(Check: 
Scoreboard, News/Video (Filter), Standings, Teams.
*Test for ALL classes*
